page.title: 04St.Peter's Williton
page.content: { A history of the Church provided {by Matthew Andrews, aged 9, son of the {present Vicar. } The Saxon King Edward was a Christian so when he visited "Willetun" he decided that he needed a place of worship and built a small {wooden chapel. } It is quite likely that King Edward's chapel stood on the same spot as our present St.Peter's. {Reginald Fitz-Urse in 1170}along with some of his fellow knights murdered {Thomas Becket. }As Reginald owned a lot of Williton some of it went to Robert, his brother, who gave most of it to{Watchet Church}and{Williton}then became like a daughter church to {Watchet. }Robert rebuilt{St. Peter's} {Church. }Below the East wall of the present church there may still be the remains of Robert's chapel.
